document.docTitle: Pselaphodes zhongdianus Yin & Li, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Notes on Michael Schuelke's pselaphine collections from China. - Tyrini. I. genera Labomimus Sharp, Linan Hlavac and Pselaphodes Westwood (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Pselaphinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Notes on Michael Schuelke's pselaphine collections from China. - Tyrini. I. genera Labomimus Sharp, Linan Hlavac and Pselaphodes Westwood (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Pselaphinae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Pselaphodes zhongdianus Yin & Li sp. n. Figs 15D19

(1 ♂). Holotype: ♂, labeled 'CHINA: N-Yunnan [C03-05] / Zhongdian Co., 46 km SSE / Zhongdian, 27°27.0'N , 99°54.7'E , / 3050-3100 m, creek valley, secondary / mixed forest, bamboo, mushrooms, / 17.VIII.2003, leg. M. Schuelke' (cSch).

Reddish brown; length 3.23; postgenae round laterally; antennomeres IX-XI enlarged, IX modified in the male; pronotum with lateral margins slightly angularly expanded laterally; with metaventral processes apically narrowed; metacoxae simple; aedeagus with asymmetric median lobe.

Placed near Pselaphodes erlangshanus and Pselaphodes flexus as discussed above, readily separated from both species by the unique antennomeres IX being strongly roundly projecting at the anterolateral margin.
Individuals was sifted from bamboo leaf litter and mushrooms in a secondary mixed forest.
The new species is named after the type locality, Zhongdian.

subSection.paragraph: Unassociated female specimens

Notes. Only the collecting data are cited here, and all specimens bear an identification label as the following, so that they can be tracked by future workers: 'Unassociated ♀ sp. xx [number] / xxx [genus name] sp. / det. Yin & Li, 2012'. Fourteen of the following species are represented by single specimens (all in cSch).

caption.paragraph: Figure 19. Diagnostic features of Pselaphodes zhongdianus . A antenna B pronotum C median meteventral process, in lateral view D protrochanter and profemur E apical portion of protibia F mesotrochanter and mesofemur G metatrochanter and metafemur H sternite IX I aedeagus, in dorsal view J same, in lateral view K same, in ventral view. Scales (mm): A, B, D, F, G = 0.3; C, I, J, K = 0.2; H, E = 0.1.
